schema.title: Schematron schema for validating conformance to IMPL_CDAR2_LEVEL1REF_US_I1_2005MAY

pattern.name: ClinicalDocument
pattern.p: This schema applies to CDA Release 2.0 documents.

rule.assert: The root of a Care Record Summary must be a ClinicalDocument element from the urn:hl7-org-v3 namespace.
When the addr element is null, it should not have content.
When the addr element is empty, it must have a value for nullFlavor.
The name of an assignedPerson must be present.
The name of a representedOrganization must be present.
The time element must be precise at least to the day.
The time element must have a time zone if more precise than to the day.
A telecom element must have a value or a flavor of null.
Telephone numbers must match the regular expression pattern tel:\+?[-0-9().]+
At least one dialing digit must be present in the phone number after visual separators are removed.
The extension attribute of the typeId element must be POCD_HD000040.
A properly formatted UUID has only 37 characters.
The first four data bytes of the UUID should be represented using hexidecimal digits ([A-Fa-f0-9]).
The fifth and sixth data bytes of the UUID should be represented using hexidecimal digits ([A-Fa-f0-9]).
The seventh and eighth data bytes of the UUID should be represented using hexidecimal digits ([A-Fa-f0-9]).
The ninth and tenth data bytes of the UUID should be represented using hexidecimal digits ([A-Fa-f0-9]).
The eleventh through sixteenth data bytes of the UUID should be represented using hexidecimal digits ([A-Fa-f0-9]).
A hyphen should separate the first four data bytes from the remainder of the UUID.
A hyphen should separate the fifth and sixth data byte from the remainder of the UUID.
A hyphen should separate the seventh and eighth data byte from the remainder of the UUID.
A hyphen should separate the ninth and tenth data byte from the remainder of the UUID.
Characters that are not in the set 0-9 or . are not present in a valid OID.
The first and last characters of an OID must be a digit.
A properly formatted OID should not contain two . characters without any intervening digits
An OID must be shorter than 65 characters.
The root attribute of the id element must be a syntactically correct UUID or OID.
The value of /ClinicalDocument/code/@code must come from the appropriate LOINC subset.
The value of /ClinicalDocument/code/@codeSystem must be 2.16.840.1.113883.6.1
The value of /ClinicalDocument/code/@codeSystemName must be LOINC.
TBD: If pre-coordinated document type codes are used, the role code and function code for the author must not conflict with the document type code.
The effectiveTime element must be precise at least to the day.
The effectiveTime element must have a time zone if precise to more than a day.
The languageCode element must be present.
The language code must be in the form nn, or nn-CC.
The language must be a legal ISO-639-1 language code in lower case.
The country code portion, if present must be an ISO-3166 country code in upper case.
When setId is present, then versionNumber must be present.
Either there is no setId, or the extension and/or root of setId and id are different.
No copyTime element is present in the ClinicalDocument.
At least one recordTarget/patientRole element exists.
The recordTarget/patientRole element has an addr element.
The recordTarget/patientRole element has a telecom element that represents a contact phone number.
A patient/birthTime element is present.
A patient/administrativeGenderCode element is present.
All providerOrganization elements have a name element.
All providerOrganization elements have an addr element.
All providerOrganization elements have a telecom element that is a telephone contact number.
The author/time element must be present.
The assignedAuthor/id element must be present.
All assignedAuthors have at least one telecom element that contains a contact phone number.
When assignedAuthoringDevice is present, the softwareName element must be present.
When assignedAuthoringDevice/softwareName must have a value.
All dataEnterer elements have an assignedEntity/assignedPerson/name element.
An informant must have either an assignedEntity/assignedPerson/name element, or a relatedEntity/relatedPerson/name element.
An informant should not have any assignedEntity/assignedPerson/crs:asPatientRelationship elements, or relatedEntity/relatedPerson/ crs:asPatientRelationship elements.
When relatedEntity/@classCode is PRS, values in relatedEntity/code shall come from the PersonalRelationshipRoleType vocabulary.
When relatedEntity/@classCode is CON, relatedEntity/code shall not be present.
When relatedEntity/@classCode is PROV, relatedEntity/code shall be descended from the healthcare professional concept (223366009) of SNOMED CT.
A custodian/assignedCustodian/representedCustodianOrganization/name element must be present.
A custodian/assignedCustodian/representedCustodianOrganization/telecom element must be present that contains a telephone contact.
A custodian/assignedCustodian/representedCustodianOrganization/addr element must be present.
All informationRecipient elements have a name element.
All receivedOrganization elements have a name element.
At least one of intendedRecipient/informationRecipient or intendedRecipient/receivedOrganization must be present.
All intendedRecipient elements have at least one telecom element that contains a contact phone number.
All intendedRecipient elements have an addr element.
All legalAuthenticator/assignedEntity elements have at least one telecom element that contains a contact phone number.
All legalAuthenticator/assignedEntity elements have an addr element.
The legalAuthenticator/assignedEntity/assignedPerson element must be present.
The assignedEntity/addr element of the authenticator element must be present.
An assignedEntity/telecom element must be present whose value contains a contact phone number.
The name element of the assignedPerson must be present.
The associatedEntity/addr element must be present.
A associatedEntity/telecom element must be present that contains a contact phone number for the participant.
When participant/@typeCode is IND, associatedEntity/@classCode must be PRS, NOK, ECON or GUAR.
When associatedEntity/@classCode is PRS, NOK or ECON then associatedEntity/code must be present having a value drawn from the PersonalRelationshipRoleType domain.
When participant/@typeCode is HLD, associatedEntity/@classCode must be POLHOLD.
When participant/@typeCode is HLD, associatedEntity/scopingOrganization must be present.
The name element must be present in a scopingOrganization element.
The addr element must be present in a scopingOrganization element.
A telecom element must be present that contains a contact phone number in a scopingOrganization element.
Only one ClinicalDocument/documentationOf element must be present.
The effectiveTime element of the serviceEvent element must be present.
The effectiveTime element must contain only one low element. The low element is unrestricted with respect to precision or time zone.
The effectiveTime element must contain only one high element. The high element is unrestricted with respect to precision or time zone.
The performer/assigneEntity/code if present must have a value drawn from the SNOMED CT healthcare professional subtype hierarchy.
Every performer/assignedEntity element has at least one assignedPerson or representedOrganization.
All performer/assignedEntity elements have an addr element.
All performer/assignedEntity elements have a telecom element that is a telephone contact number.
All assignedPerson elements of performer/assignedEntity must have a name element.
The name element must be present in a performer/assignedEntity/representedOrganization element.
The addr element must be present in a performer/assignedEntity/representedOrganization element.
A telecom element must be present that contains a contact phone number in a performer/assignedEntity/representedOrganization element.

assert.test: /cda:ClinicalDocument/cda:componentOf or not(document("voc.xml")/systems/system[@codeSystemName="LOINC"]/code[@value = current()]/@displayName = "DISCHARGE SUMMARIZATION NOTE" or document("voc.xml")/systems/system[@codeSystemName="LOINC"]/code[@value = current()/@code]/@displayName = "TRANSFER SUMMARIZATION NOTE")

The encompassingEncounter element must have an effectiveTime element.
If ClinicalDocument/code/@value represents a Discharge Summarization Note, then dischargeDispositionCode must be present.
The encounterParticipant/assignedEntity element must have an addr element.
The encounterParticipant/assignedEntity element must have a telecom element that represents a telephone contact number.
The encounterParticipant/assignedEntity element must have at least one assignedPerson or representedOrganization element present.
The responsibleParty/assignedEntity element must have an addr element.
The responsibleParty/assignedEntity element must have a telecom element that represents a telephone contact number.
The responsibleParty/assignedEntity element must have at least one assignedPerson or representedOrganization element present.
A cda:section element must have a cda:code element.
A cda:section must contain at least one cda:text element or one or more cda:component elements.
All cda:text or cda:component elements must contain content.
A Discharge or Transfer summary must include a section element whose code is 11535-2.
A Summary of Episode note that is not a discharge or transfer summary must include a section element whose code is 11450-4.
A section must be present with a code value of 10155-0.
A Discharge or Transfer summary must include a section element whose code is 10183-2.
A Summary of Episode note that is not also a discharge or transfer summary must include a section element whose code is 10160-0.
A level 2 conforming Care Record Summary that is a discharge or transfer summary shall contain a section with the code value of 8648-8.

A level 2 conforming Care Record Summary that contains a section with a code value of X-RFVCC (REASON FOR VISIT/CHIEF COMPLAINT) shall not contain sections with a code value of 29299-5 (REASON FOR VISIT) or 10154-3 (CHIEF COMPLAINT).

The section type code for the section describing the reason for visit in a level 2 conforming Care Record Summary shall be either X-RFVCC (REASON FOR VISIT/CHIEF COMPLAINT), or 29299-5 (REASON FOR VISIT).

The section type code for the section describing the patient's chief complaint in a level 2 conforming Care Record Summary shall be either X-RFVCC (REASON FOR VISIT/CHIEF COMPLAINT), or 10154-3 (CHIEF COMPLAINT).

A level 2 conforming Care Record Summary that contains a section with a code value of X-RFVCC (REASON FOR VISIT/CHIEF COMPLAINT) shall not contain sections with a code value of 29299-5 (REASON FOR VISIT) or 10154-3 (CHIEF COMPLAINT).
The code for the section describing the Reason for Referral in a level 2 conforming Care Record Summary shall be X-RFR (REASON FOR REFERRAL).
The code for the section describing the patient Advance Directives in a level 2 conforming Care Record Summary shall be X-ADVDIR (ADVANCE DIRECTIVES).
The LOINC section type code for the section describing the History of Present Illness in a level 2 conforming Care Record Summary shall be 10164-2 (HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS).
The LOINC section type code for the section describing the patient's functional status in a level 2 conforming Care Record Summary shall be 10158-4 (HISTORY OF FUNCTIONAL STATUS).
The LOINC section type code for the section providing family history of the patient in a level 2 conforming Care Record Summary shall be 10157-6 (HISTORY OF FAMILY MEMBER DISEASES).
The LOINC section type code for the section providing immunization history in a level 2 conforming Care Record Summary shall be 11369-6 (HISTORY OF IMMUNIZATION).
The LOINC section type code for the section describing the patient's past surgical history in a level 2 conforming Care Record Summary shall be 10167-5 (PAST SURGICAL HISTORY).
The LOINC section code used for the section describing prior outpatient visits in a level 2 conforming Care Record Summary shall be 11346-4 (HISTORY OF OUTPATIENT VISITS).
The LOINC section code used for the section describing prior hospitalizations in a level 2 conforming Care Record Summary shall be 11336-5 (HISTORY OF HOSPITALIZATIONS).
The LOINC section code used for the section providing the patient vital signs in a level 2 conforming Care Record Summary shall be 8716-3 (VITAL SIGNS, PHYSICAL FINDINGS).

The LOINC section code used for the section describing results or referring to other reports in a level 2 conforming Care Record Summary shall be 11493-4 (HOSPITAL DISCHARGE STUDIES SUMMARY), or X-SS (STUDIES SUMMARY)
The LOINC section code used for the section describing the plan of care for the patient in a level 2 conforming Care Record Summary shall be 18775-6 (TREATMENT PLAN)
